title: Bug 19651 - Team menu disappears from Hierarchy and Packages view
description: The team menu was present in step 9, but is now missing. Note: TestClass.java is not in any CVS repository, but I first encountered the problem with a file managed by CVS.
OB: 9) When selecting TestClass (the class, not the unit) in the package view and opening the popup menu, the team menu is present (although disabled).
EB:
11) After selecting the word InnerClass in the text editor and pressing F4, the team menu is missing from the new hierarchy view. This is expected since InnerClass is an inner class.
13) After selecting the word TestClass in the new text editor and pressing F4, the team menu is missing. However, it should be present since TestClass is not an inner class.
15) After selecting TestClass in the package view and opening the popup menu, the team menu is no longer there.
SR:
Steps to reproduce the bug (Build F2):
1) Open Eclipse with a new workspace.
2) Switch to the Java perspective and close the resource perspective.
3) Create a Java Project named TestProject.
4) Create a Java class named TestClass.
5) Paste the given code in the TestClass and save it.
6) Change preferenceWorkbenchPerspective to open perspective in a new window.
7) Change preferenceJava to 'Open a new Type Hierarchy Perspective'.
8) Exit the workbench and restart it.
10) After restarting the workbench, proceed with steps 11-15 as described above. You should have 3 opened windows. Close the two new windows.
